alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Sequoyah; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:34AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Benton, west central Washington, Delaware, northeastern McIntosh, northwestern Sequoyah, Mayes, Adair, eastern Wagoner, Cherokee and Muskogee Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 634 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Chloeta to 3 miles northwest of Okay to 2 miles east of Council Hill. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Bella Vista... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Sallisaw... Wagoner... Stilwell... Jay... Pryor Creek... Fort Gibson... Checotah... Gentry... Gravette... Chouteau... Decatur... Warner... Westville... Vian... Locust Grove... Salina... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 267 and 302. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Sequoyah; Wagoner
